Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic mathematical text on recto and verso, parts of several columns concerned with arithmetical problems. On small lebl is registrtaion number '68.11.2.507'
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Ritner R K, 1996, in Fs. Simpson, p.686. The papyrus was published by Parker, Egyptian Demotic Mathematical Texts, but since then new fragments have been identified by Carol Andrews from a made-up roll (initially registered as EA 10981) and remounted with EA 10399 from what has since been registered as EA 76420. A. Imhausen, Mathematics in Ancient Egypt. A Contextual History (Princeton and Oxford 2016), 184. Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (55977) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/55977)
Parker 1972 / Demotic Mathematical Papyri (p. 53-65, no. 41-52, pl. 15-18.)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: delaminating, fragmentary, fractured, loss Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Tabbed: court plaster Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: incomplete/fragmentary
